utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Two one six four two zero one nine eight nine. And that, little lady, is pi to a thousand places.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I’d say I’m sorry I asked, except I didn’t.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, look, it’s the Scientific American that covered the paper Leonard and I wrote.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Oh, let me see.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I have mixed feelings about doing interviews. I like the part where I talk. I do not like the part where the other man talks.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Sheldon, this article doesn’t mention Leonard at all.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, that can’t be right.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: It only refers to Dr. Cooper and his team. Did you even talk about him?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: All I did was answer a few questions about the theory. And then expressed my gratitude that Scientific American doesn’t include any of those smelly perfume cards.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Poor Leonard.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Why? The theory he came up with just got mentioned in Scientific American. He ought to be thrilled.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: He might not be.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, maybe you’re right. He is kind of a lump.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Think about it. How would you feel if you were referred to as part of Leonard’s team?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, I’d be incensed.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: So you see what I’m getting at?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Squeaky wheel gets the grease?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Grass is always greener?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Try again.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, I don’t know, we’re all Groot? Just tell me.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Leonard is as much a part of this paper as you are, and he was overlooked. He’s going to feel bad.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: But it wasn’t my fault. I didn’t exclude him. And I didn’t write the article.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Remember that time you didn’t get picked to pull the sword out of the stone at Disneyland and they let that other kid do it?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, that kid. Poor Leonard.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Exactly.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: For the record, that kid was a terrible choice. If you cry when you drop your churro, you do not have what it takes to rule England.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Thanks for helping us sort through all my mom’s stuff.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Of course. I know what it’s like having to go through a loved one’s possessions. My uncle was a worshipper of Krishna. But after he died, you know what we found? A statue of Shiva. It may not be Crips and Bloods, okay? But in India, it’s a thing.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Well, it’ll be good that you’re there. Howard’s been having trouble deciding what to keep and what to let go.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Well, it’s hard. A lot of Ma’s stuff brings back fond memories.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Is that why you couldn’t get rid of her drawer full of ketchup packets?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Yes. It reminds me of us eating out and her saying quick, nobody’s looking, fill your pockets with ketchup.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Leonard? Have you ever noticed that only my name is on the cable bill?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Good, good. And your name is on the electric bill and mine isn’t. And I’m okay with that.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Actually, your name is on the electric bill.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, right. This is a disaster.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I don’t even know what you’re talking about and I agree.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Okay, I have to tell you something, but you’re not going to like it.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: What’s going on?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: An article was just published in Scientific American about our theory.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Did they hate it?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: No. No, they loved it. They, uh, couldn’t say enough nice things about it.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: So what’s the problem?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You know how the PennySaver only has my name…

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Sheldon.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: They didn’t mention you in the article. Only me.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Really?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I know. It’s not fair. Let the anger go, buddy. You just, you relax all your muscles. Except for your pubococcygeus and anal sphincter. Let’s keep those tight.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Uh, that, that’s not necessary.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: It is. They’re what hold back the urine and the faeces. Look, maybe, maybe you shouldn’t read it. It’ll only make you feel worse.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Cooper and his team?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You should know I had nothing to do with that.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Uh, at least they’re talking about the theory. I mean, that’s what’s important.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You know, you’re right. Yeah. You know, it’s like when Stan Lee and Steve Ditko created Spider-Man. Stan Lee may get all the credit, but Steve Ditko knows he was just as important. Even though Stan Lee gets to be in all the Marvel movies. And. and he’s far richer. And he’s a household name, you know? Whereas, you know, you say Ditko, and that sounds like a company that makes Dits.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: That’s not helping.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, I’d give more examples, but, well, everyone in your position’s so forgettable.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Stuart, we’re here.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: It’s nice of you to let him keep staying at your mom’s house.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Yeah, well, I tried putting him out on the curb, but nobody took him.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Hey. Just so you know, the power’s out.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: What happened?

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: I called, they said a transformer blew. It’s the whole block. Should be fixed by tomorrow.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Wait, when did it go out?

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: In the middle of the night.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Oh, my God.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Howie, what’s wrong?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: It’s all defrosting.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: It’s okay. It’s just food.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: It’s not just food. This is the last food my mother ever made. This is her last brisket. This is her last meatloaf. This is her last. I have no idea what this is, but it’s the last one.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Everything okay?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: No. All Ma’s food is gonna be ruined.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Well, why don’t we take it home and put it in our freezer?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: You don’t want to do that. Refreezing not only removes moisture, but it creates ice crystals in the fibres of the meat that can compromise its taste and texture. What? I saw a teachable moment. I dropped some culinary science.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: What should we do?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I’ll tell you exactly what we’re gonna do. We’re gonna eat it.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: There’s, like, twenty pounds of food in there.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: All you said was I had to get rid of things. You didn’t say they couldn’t pass through my colon first.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Howie.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Okay. Then how about this? Let’s invite everyone over to dinner. It’ll be like Ma’s feeding us one last time.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: I love that.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Me, too. Oh, look, we’ve got enough ketchup to cover every ounce of it.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I mean, who even reads Scientific American?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: It’s kind of a big deal.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: If it’s such a big deal, how come the biggest celebrity they could get for the cover is a molecule?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Can we please just stop talking about it?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I’m sorry. What can I do?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Nothing, I’m fine.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: No, no. I’m gonna cheer you up. Here we go.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: What are we doing?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I am taking you shopping.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: My baby is sad, and I’m gonna make him happy again.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Look, I know shopping cheers you up, but it’s just not really my thing.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Well, what about this helicopter you control with an iPad?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Does it have a camera in it?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: It does have a camera in it.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Baby’s listening.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Leonard? Leonard? Leonard?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I spoke to the reporter at the magazine.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: What happened? Did you tell him it was my idea?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I did.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Thank you. What did he say?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: He said they made the editorial decision to only cite the lead scientist.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Why did he think you’re the lead scientist? It was my idea.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: You know, for an extra four bucks, I can have this thing here tomorrow.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, I know it was your idea, but the reporter said he’s been following my work for a while, and the only reason they even mentioned it in the magazine is ’cause my name is on it.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: You know what? I did it. What’s four bucks?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: If you’re trying to make me feel better, it’s not working.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well then what if I told you that I added your name to the cable bill?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh. That’s just as well. They had me on hold for 20 minutes and I hung up. Leonard? Leonard? Leonard? Also, Wolowitz invited us all to dinner, so I’m ready whenever you are.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: All he had was an idea.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Well, that is an important part.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, please. I have ideas all day long. Reverse SeaWorld where dolphins are allowed to pet people. A new clothing size between medium and large called Marge. Snow White retold from the point of view of Sneezy. Why won’t Doc prescribe him something? We finally find out.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: But Leonard’s idea was good.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Fine. Then Grumpy, what’s he so grumpy about? Maybe his girlfriend won’t take his side.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I’m the one who thought of it.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Well, didn’t he do a lot of the work?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yeah. But now he’s happy to let people think he’s responsible for everything.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: And that’s why you get an iPad helicopter.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Is it my fault I have a much bigger reputation than he does?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: It’s not your fault.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Is it my fault that my name came first on the paper alphabetically?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Not your fault.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Is it my fault that when the reporter cited me as the lead scientist I didn’t correct him?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Hey, look at that pretty bird.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: He always needs all the attention. He’s such a baby.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I know, I know.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I swear, he is never ever playing with my helicopter.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Okay, I’ll start heating some of this stuff up.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Thanks.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Oh, man. This is the boutonniere from my high school prom. A piece of cake from my Bar Mitzvah.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Did she throw anything away?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: No. If I find my foreskin, I’m gonna kill myself.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Okay, so we’ve got, um, three briskets, four meatloafs, one lasagna.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: No, that’s noodle kugel.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: One Jewish lasagna, two pound cakes that are about eight pounds each, and one giant container of matzoh ball soup.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Ma always kept it on hand, in case I got sick. She thought she could cure anything with her cooking. Even the time I got food poisoning. From her cooking.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: You okay?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Yeah, I’m okay. Let’s get started.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: You got it.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I’m never gonna talk to her again.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Should we tell everyone not to come?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: No. I want to do this.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Okay. Well, I’ll keep it together if you can.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I’m not making any promises.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Glad you guys could make it.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Of course.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Wow, it looks really pretty in here.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Yeah, turns out half a dozen menorahs really sets a mood.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: So, Stuart, have you thought about what you’d do if Howard sells the house?

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: And there goes the mood.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Hi. Hello. Oh, and a special hello to Leonard, who needs to be mentioned by name.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Subtle.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: But you got it, right?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Hey, guys.

utterance.speaker: All
utterance.content: Hey. Hi. Hello.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I just want everyone to know, uh, tonight’s not a sad occasion.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Yeah, we just want to have the kind of dinner that we’ve all had here so many times before.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Good food, good friends, and sometime around midnight, heartburn that makes you pray for death.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Do you need any help in the kitchen?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: No, we got it. You guys make yourselves comfortable.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: All right, hey, you two, we’re here for Howard right now, okay?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Yes, so please behave yourselves.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Fine.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Of course.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: So I heard you two, uh, wrote a paper together. How’s that going?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: This food is amazing.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Mm, and not a vegetable in sight.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: That’s not true. We’ve got tomatoes right here.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: All these bright people sitting around a table by candlelight. Feels like we could be an 18th century French salon.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Indeed. Penny, a salon is a gathering where intellectuals entertained each other with sparkling conversations about issues of the day.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, so it’s like The View.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Sheldon, The View is a daytime talk show hosted by women.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, I’m aware. It features Whoopi Goldberg. She played Guinan on Star Trek: Next Gen. Penny, Next Gen refers to Star Trek…

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Shut up.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I would like to propose a salon topic.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Ooh, please do, Rajesh.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: The lead in The Hunger Games is a woman. Marvel has made Tor a female.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Wait, who’s Tor?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: You know, Tor, the God of Tunder. As I was saying, is this a sign that our society is approaching gender equality?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Certainly a lot more women are reading comic books now.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: It’s true. At the store, I had to put a seat on the toilet.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: We won’t know if there’s equality until female Thor has a baby and the Avengers are cool with her pumping breast milk at work.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I wonder if only a baby who is worthy can suckle at the bosom of Thor.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay, new salon topic. Salons, dumb thing from a long time ago or interesting thing made dumb by talking about superheroes? Discuss.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I don’t believe it matters what the topic is. What’s crucial for a salon is that we conduct the discussion in an elevated and insightful way. It’s all about the execution.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Of course you’d focus on that rather than the inspiration. Uh, new salon topic. What’s more important, an idea or its execution?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Oh, that’s fine.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yeah, good for you, Leonard. That’s a lovely little notion. Kind of like, I wish I could talk to my uncle in Chicago. Yeah, now stand back while I invent the telephone. Hello? Oh, hold on. Leonard, it’s your uncle. He says you just got burned.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Sheldon.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Guys.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: No, it’s okay. We’re all adults trying to have an intelligent discussion. At least I am. Howard, what do you think?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Well, I guess, as an engineer, I lean towards execution. I spend my days trying to take ideas and make them real.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well said, old chap. I thought eloquence had died, here it stands before us. Starting today, it’ll go Gettysburg Address, I have a dream, and what he just said.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh, now he’s a genius? All you ever do is make fun of him and engineering.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Leonard, please. His mother just died.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: You’re being ridiculous.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yeah, so are you.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Guys, if I wanted to hear people be bitchy, I’d go to my real salon.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Leonard, lots of people could’ve had that idea, but very few people could’ve worked out the math the way I did.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Lots of people also didn’t have that idea, like everyone in the entire world except for me.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, well, apparently Leonard thinks he’s better than everyone in the whole world, including those fighting for our freedom. Yeah, well, I don’t know about you, but I support our boys overseas.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: And girls.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Hey, you already ruined Thor, give it a rest.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: So I’m just supposed to be okay with you hogging all the credit?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I didn’t hog anything. Unlike you and that weird lasagna with raisins in it.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: You want some of this? I’ll give you some.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Hey. Sheldon, Leonard, living room, right now!

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: She said my name first, that must kill you.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette (off)
utterance.content: I don’t know what you think you’re doing, but this is a very difficult time for my husband. We’re eating the last food his mother ever made, and you were gonna throw it at each other like children? Whatever it is you’re fighting about, put it aside, go back in there and be a good friend to Howard or there’s no dessert for either of you. Look at me when I’m talking to you. And don’t think…

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: You guys ever notice sometimes Bernadette sounds like my mom?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I don’t hear it.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: No, not at all.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I don’t think I’ve eaten that much in my entire life.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: It’s why my people wandered the desert for 40 years. Took that long to walk it off.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You see, Penny, the Israelites were in the desert…

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Shut up.

utterance.speaker: Ra
utterance.content: So glad you two are done fighting.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Right now, I’m just trying to burp without throwing up.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Hang on. Physics Today mentioned the paper.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: What’d they say?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Who cares? Did they mention Leonard?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: They did.

utterance.speaker: All
utterance.content: Yay.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Good news, I found more Tums.

utterance.speaker: All
utterance.content: Yay.
